marklogic.body:
Wrong, Wrong and Wrong - but ok
1. The reason vouchers and charters are bad for public education is that they take money away from public schools. Two systems are more expensive to run than 1. The vouchers and charters usually perform below the public schools. 2. When the charter and voucher schools fail, the students go back to the public schools. I don't remember where I read this, but one school district will stop accepting charter and voucher students if they get kicked out. The past few years, charter and voucher schools would keep kids long enough to put them on their state counts then jetison them to public schools. They get the money and the public schools get the Headaches. 3. Many things are run better by government and monopolies. Rural electric cooperatives work because of government assistance, but they all pay the bills at competitive rates. Municipal water, sewer, electric, and cable systems work much better and much cheaper than the for profit competitors. Example is medicom. In Spencer Iowa, a small northwest Iowa town, Medicom cable package is 1/2 of what the same package is in Des Moines, Why - government run cable - you would think this evil, but medicom is making money. Municipal electricity in Milford, my home town, is much cheaper than for profit electricity in Spirit Lake. Spirit Lake is nearly twice as big, so should be cheaper. It is much more expensive, less responsive and much older infrastructure. Let's face it. The line that government can't do anything right is just wrong. Most of the rest of the world has private water supplies. US is dominated by public water. US water supplies are much less expensive and have better quality of water.
Education can improve, but arguments that schools are made for the teachers and not the students are just not helpful. As we get into the techonological Era, we need to reform schools and how teachers teach. Much more personal instruction and probably individual education plans for every student. However, as long as we have a commitment to nonsensical standardized tests, school can't reform. As long as teachers are seen as the enemy, treated with continued disrespect, their is no reason they would change.
